channel.title: Reverse Engineering++
channel.itunes:subtitle: Nerd Talk I/O
channel.itunes:summary: Aaron and Dell talk Reverse Engineering++ -- infosec, materials science, 3d printing, and a smattering of other nerdy matters. An audio hacky makerspace. You can find more at https://www.repp.show
channel.description: Aaron and Dell talk Reverse Engineering++ -- infosec, materials science, 3d printing, and a smattering of other nerdy matters. An audio hacky makerspace. You can find more at https://www.repp.show
channel.itunes:author: Aaron and Dell

item.title: Ep. 0 - Reverse Engineering Plus Plus
item.itunes:title: Ep. 0 - Reverse Engineering Plus Plus
item.description: Hello world from Aaron and Dell. In this ep, we talk motivation for the show, talk shop about some tooling, and talk about some other nerd shows that inspire us.
item.itunes:summary: Hello world from Aaron and Dell. In this ep, we talk motivation for the show, talk shop about some tooling, and talk about some other nerd shows that inspire us.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ep. 0 - Hello world from Aaron and Dell.

item.title: Ep. 1 - Post DEF CON 30 Wrap-Up
item.itunes:title: Ep. 1 - Post DEF CON 30 Wrap-Up
item.description: In this Episode, some highlights from DC30 -- the good, the bad, the ugly and some great talks about remotely stopping trucks, an audio engineer's take on infosec, and a tool for dynamic reverse engineering.
item.itunes:summary: In this Episode, some highlights from DC30 -- the good, the bad, the ugly and some great talks about remotely stopping trucks, an audio engineer's take on infosec, and a tool for dynamic reverse engineering.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ep. 1 - DEFCON30 Wrap-Up.

item.title: Ep. 2 - Basics: Flash
item.itunes:title: Ep. 2 - Basics: Flash
item.description: Starting at the beginning of the RE process, we cover some different types of flash you may encounter and introduce the TL866 to pull off the memory from them. A typical first step in hardware RE.
item.itunes:summary: Starting at the beginning of the RE process, we cover some different types of flash you may encounter and introduce the TL866 to pull off the memory from them. A typical first step in hardware RE.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ep. 2 - Basics: Flash
